title: Non-normable spaces of analytic functions
abstract:
For each value of $p$ such that $0<p<1$, we give a specific example of two
functions in the Hardy space $H^p$ and in the Bergman space $A^p$ that do not
satisfy the triangle inequality. For Hardy spaces, this provides a much simpler
proof than the one due to Livingston that involves abstract functional analysis
arguments and an approximation theorem. For Bergman spaces, we have not been
able to locate any examples or proofs in the existing literature.
